articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
About Me
Hello! My name is Stephanie Saab and I’m an incoming first-year student at the University of Toronto. I love to play basketball and the piano.
About the Project
This is my final project for Kane’s Data science bootcamp: These boots were made for shopping. This site features a few plots comparing shoe shopping tendencies and prices for men and women.
Goals
Explore the variation in prices of women’s and men’s shoes
These were collected from two datasets on kaggle.com

Explore the different spending habits of women and men in regards to shoes
This sample only includes 10000 shoe purchases in the U.S.
“This is data science”
~Preceptor
“Kane’s Free High School Data Science Bootcamp”

articles.title: Source A
articles.contents:
Source A was Primer.data. It was flawless (Kane 2020)
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.

Kane, David. 2020. Primer.data.

articles.title: Source B
articles.contents:
The datasets for the plots were sourced from kaggle.com at the following links:
Data for women’s shoes: https://www.kaggle.com/datafiniti/womens-shoes-prices
Data for men’s shoes: https://www.kaggle.com/sureshmecad/mens-shoe-prices
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill for R Markdown at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.
